metadata.synopsis: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD-Main_A3. goto -654.75, 10.00, 420.755. Talk to the Skeleton near the banner flag and torch

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: Dark Justiciar uniforms... these were Shar worshippers - the same as me.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: Dark Justiciar uniforms... these were Shar worshippers - her most elite warriors. Curious.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Allow the expert to explore these bones a touch.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of the Dark Lady - and you realise you know these uniforms.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, a reviled order within Shar's priesthood - one whose rite of entry includes killing a cleric of Selûne.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: To the dust! Die in filth!

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: Watch your tongue - these were my brethren.
60.context: NodeContext: Sharp retort (she's known to be a Shar worshipper)

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Enough. Whatever your petty squabbles, let them rot with these corpses.

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: Better dead than stuck down here. Right?

82.speaker: Astarion
82.text: Don't be touchy. I'm sure they meant 'better off dead' as a compliment.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: Now, now. Take a breath, count to ten. This battle's been long-finished - no reason to fight it again.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Don't turn on each other. If whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: I'm sure they'd consider the feeling mutual, if they could.
122.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player disrespected her dead Shar-worshipping comrades, but she's still keeping that part of herself a secret.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: Maybe. But if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: Let's hope whoever killed them has long since marched on.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: Let's just hope whatever managed to plough through 'em is long dead, too.

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: Some of us are dead and doing very well, thank you.
114.context: NodeContext: In response to 'Evil goddess worshippers. Better off dead.'

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: And better off still than being skewered by the point of my blade.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Try to bow in respect for the dead.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *Your wicked heart won't mourn. Deaths are to be celebrated. Every one.*

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Whatever killed them, at least it rid the world of some of its evil.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Something powerful killed them. We must be careful.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: Yes, we should press forward. These dead have no more tales to tell.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: As you like. Hopefully my own remains are treated with a little more dignity, when the time comes...
40.context: NodeContext: A little solemn (She saw some of her comrade's bodies abandoned where they died - she may or may not be known as a Shar worshipper at this point).

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: I'll keep an eye out. If it's a demon, I'll be able to spot it a mile off.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: Agreed. Let's go, we have places to be.

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: Let's get moving, then. Once we fill our packs with what we can carry, of course.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Let's not. But a word of warning: down here in the Underdark, few dangers ever truly die.

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Indeed. We will avenge them if we can. And who knows? Perhaps other children of Shar are still to be found down here...
4.context: NodeContext: Spoken to a fellow shar worshipper. They found the remains of some of their brethren in the underdark, long dead.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Bah - let Shar exact her own revenge, if she's so inclined. Our concerns lie far elsewhere.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: I think the evil god of loss can avenge herself, if she needs to.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: By all means, avenge Shar, but can we do it later? The worm is more important than your piety.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: Let's come back to this later, yeah? We've got more pressing matters afoot.

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: Whatever it was that killed them, if it managed to murder a group of Sharrans, we had better watch our step.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: Quite bold of you to flaunt your Shar worship so openly. I hear that's ill-advised.
119.context: NodeContext: Knowing and pointed. Shadowheart is aware that the player worships Shar, but the player does not know the same is true of her when she speaks this line.

124.speaker: Gale
124.text: If it managed to murder a group of Sharrans, we had better watch our step.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: If their killer's still around, it's not Shar's name I'm most interested in saving.

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Be careful what you wish for, soldier.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Don't waste your time hoping. It's probably long dead.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Of course, being dead doesn't stop everyone in their tracks. But hopefully it's somewhere quiet, decaying peacefully.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: Shar's name is no more our concern than a gnat's egg. Turn your attentions to something of actual import.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Among the various fabrics, you recognise the unmistakable symbol of Shar, the Dark Lady.*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Try to bow in respect for the dead.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Whatever killed them made an enemy of a powerful goddess.

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: Bah - let Shar exact her own revenge, if she's so inclined. Our concerns lie far elsewhere.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Whatever killed a bunch of Sharrans might still be down here. Just saying.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: I'm sure Shar is powerful enough to take her own revenge. No need for us to get involved.

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: Let's come back to this later, yeah? We've got more pressing matters afoot.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: Still, if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: Still, if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Let us do what we can to avoid their fate, then.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Whatever killed a bunch of Sharrans might still be down here. Just saying.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Powerful enough to take her own revenge, I'm sure. No need for us to get involved.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: And she has since exacted her revenge, undoubtedly.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

76.speaker: Player
76.text: No use trying to figure out what happened a hundred years ago. Let's focus on our problems at hand.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Yes, we should press forward. But let's not presume the past always remains buried.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: As you like. But don't presume whatever killed them is a thing of the past. Some battles span centuries.
55.context: NodeContext: she's contemplating the ongoing hostilities between Shar and Selune's forces as she says this

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: You took the words right out of my mouth, soldier.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: Yes, there's not much we can do for dusty old soldiers. Let's get moving.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: If we must. Oh, but imagine what tales these bones might tell if they could.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: Down here in the Underdark, few dangers ever truly die.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Look at those uniforms. They must have belonged to some kind of sect.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: Unusually robust uniforms - warriors fallen in battle, perhaps.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: Cut down and left to rot. Such fine armour deserved better.

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: Such handsome armour - a fighting force of some renown, perhaps.
